conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine the distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval.
The initial velocity of the skydiver from the graph is 20 m/s.
Calculate the distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval using the formula: Distance = Velocity x Time, resulting in 200 meters.
Compare the calculated distance of 200 meters to 100 meters, concluding it is greater.
Conclude the answer based on the comparison: the distance is greater than 100 meters.
